intro: Pimpinella pubescens, commonly known as the hairy cowbane, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Pimpinella pubescens is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
